intro: Gutenbergia macrocephala, commonly known as the giant skullcap, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy wildflowers. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a distinctive lobed structure that aids in photosynthesis in its alpine habitat. Gutenbergia macrocephala is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to cool, moist environments.
